messages.content: What is ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM and what does it enable users to do?
ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM is a custom node that allows users to use Convolutional Reconstruction Models (CRM) directly from ComfyUI for high-fidelity feed-forward single image-to-3D generative tasks.
What improvements does ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM have over the official CRM implementation?

ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM has several improvements, including support for CPU generation, removal of xformers requirement, separation of the inference pipeline, automatic input image processing, high-speed and high-quality output formats, integration with ComfyUI's internal attention code, cleaner code with fewer dependencies and less memory usage.

To install ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM, you need to install ComfyUI first. Then, clone the repository into the custom_nodes folder, install the dependencies, download CRM models, and place them in the appropriate directory. Additionally, you may need to install ComfyUI_essentials to run example workflows.
Does ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM support GPU rendering with low VRAM?
Yes, ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM has been adapted to run on low VRAM GPUs by separating the inference pipeline into three parts, which allows for flexibility in altering inputs at any step.
What special preparations might be required for Windows users with CUDA GPUs to use NVdiffrast with ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM?
Windows users with CUDA GPUs might need to set the CUDA_HOME environment variable and follow the windows installation instructions provided by the official documentation of nvdiffrast.
What should I do if I encounter the error 'Expected all tensors to be on the same device, but found at least two devices, cuda:0 and cpu!' while running ComfyUI-Flowty-CRM?
If you encounter this error, try restarting ComfyUI and running only the CUDA workflow to ensure that all operations are performed on the GPU.
